job_title: IT Project Manager in Sacramento Valley
pros: Great benefits, best wok culture, good PTO, Christmas week off.
cons: No bonuses. More diversification of day to day duties would be great

pros:
Mission, purpose driven work.
Colleagues who truly care about the work and each other.
Flexible environment that encourages balance.
Salary that reflects the work….outpaces most associations I’ve seen.
Excellent benefits with generous PTO.
cons:
Organization works hard on behalf of members which can lead to taking on a lot and prioritization is not always clear.
As with many associations (and organizations), resource constraints (people and budget) exist.
Many long term employees which can sometimes make impacting change difficult.

review_title: At CDA, everyone thinks they can do your job better than you
pros: Generous benefits and PTO. Handled the covid-19 crisis well overall. Good at sharing company-wide updates and communications on a regular basis.
cons:
Marketing gets very little independence or respect throughout the organization. Every other department makes requests from marketing down to every detail, so the smart people who work here end up as mere producers of work they could do so much better if they were given the freedom and trust to do so. There was massive disrespect to our group from other leaders in the company, including from the chief people officer, who you would think and hope would be one to unite and help develop healthier relationships between teams. 

CDA seems to let toxic personalities thrive, moving them into positions of leading people and projects into absolute chaos. There is constant finger pointing and two-facedness at every corner, which is really sad. The well-being of teams is majorly de-prioritized. It is consistently acknowledged that everyone is burnt out and miserable and processes and teams are broken, yet nothing gets done to fix it. 

This could be a great place to work, and many times I had hopes that it was improving, but it was always just talk.

job_title: Senior Technical Support Specialist in Sacramento, CA
pros: People there were great and enjoyed working there every day
cons: Sometimes management makes the wrong decision.

review_title: If you value your sanity look elsewhere
pros: Some people are very friendly, good balance
cons:
Very old school management, some who have been here for 40 years and don't want to change with the time. The CPO and CIO are both a joke, there is extreme favoritism from management and if they don't like you, well you are as good as gone. 

The President has no idea what is going on and only looks at the end results. The board that leads the org is full of old heads and there is a reason why other dental organizations are moving up and it's only a matter of time until this org goes under.

If you value your career and sanity, look elsewhere.

pros: Low base pay but great benefits.
cons: Some people can be mean but most of the people are friendly. They were affected during the start of the Pandemic so a lot of people were laid off

pros: They pay their employees well.
cons: This is a fully remote job.

pros: Good benefits, good vacation time nice work life balance
cons: Sometimes the direction they go is a little haphazard

pros: Excellent leadership and C-suite. Flexible and supportive management.
cons: Like many associations, there are challenges with shifting the mindset of volunteers.

pros: Great company, also lots of opportunity to move up within the company. My experience has been great here.
cons: I currently do not have any cons to report working with this organization/company here at this time.

review_title: Good experience builder, perfect for short term, Marketing was a dead end role with no where to grow or learn.
pros: Great benefits, work life balance, fun coworkers, Excellent PTO with company wide shutdown Christmas to NYE
cons: Multiple layoffs, no merit increases,  random projects that do have a strategy

job_title: Human Resources Coordinator (HR Coordinator) in Sacramento, CA
pros: Flexible working schedule and great benefits!
cons: Poor communication and untrained management.

pros: Good local company with great CEO
cons: Growing pains transitioning to industry standards

job_title: Business Development Manager in Sacramento, CA
pros: Strong organization, team oriented, member driven
cons: The pandemic from COVID-19 resulted in downsizing

pros: Great benefits, you probably won't find better.  Great location and offices.  HR was great to deal with and really seemed to go extra steps to address concerns.  Very profitable business and all the perks that come with making a lot of money (even though they are non-profit).
cons: Upper management is all dirty politics and old school tactics.  People are not promoted on merit.  Management has all been there 10 plus years, everyone below them 3 years or less.  That should tell you everything you need to know.  Upper management is very much focused on how things "look" rather than how things actually work.  While insurance makes a lot of money, its not because of what management is doing but despite.   Nothing is going to change because the business makes gobs of money.  If you just want a nice office and don't mind unethical, unprofessional management, then you could do fine here for years.  If you want to develop and advance, better to find a company that realizes it is 2015 and not 1988.

pros: Wonderful people who are very focused on providing great services to our members. I've worked for a few major corporations in my career, including some non-for-profits, that were very focused on profit. CDA is focused on members first. This is also a company that takes very good care of staff with great benefits and wages. The team I'm on is fun and people care about doing a good job.
cons: No place is perfect and CDA is experiencing some growing pains. Lot's of new employees and new services we are offering to support dentists. These are good things for CDA, dentist and staff. Change is sometimes hard for people and we have changes taking place right now. I don't see that as negative because it's about growth and expansion of service. More opportunities for us as employees to do exciting work and grow in our careers.

pros: I worked on the PMO/IT side of CDA/TDIC.  From what I could see, the pure CDA side is really well run.  The CDA Cares and the CDA Presents conferences and activities are top notch.  The other groups like marketing seem to be well run and very professional.  CDA has great benefits and the building is spectacular.
cons:
I share the sentiment of others who wrote reviews.  The company is highly political.  It's all about appearances and looking good.  Deep down, they don't care about their employees.  The managers are great at politics but lacks vision.  

The company will spend gobs of money on contractors but won't give their own workers bonuses for doing a good job or working hard. 

They don't value diversity.  If you don't fit into the CDA mold, you are done.  Once it has been established that you are different, maybe too outspoken or maybe a little rough around the edges, that's it.  You have no chance.  They don't value hard work and dedication, they only value politics and making themselves look good.

If you get in the right department and you are involved in CDA Cares or CDA Presents, you are OK.  Some departments are poorly managed, they just don't know how to run complex IT projects.

pros:
Four weeks vacation time for newly hired salaried associates
Parking/transportation credit available
cons: Due to the structure and size of the association, it can be difficult to quickly implement changes

pros: The CDA is a member services organization that focuses on serving its members by provides dentists with the knowledge and issues that can affect a dental practice.
cons: Needs to develop better websites

pros: They mean well and the people are hard working, compassionate and committed.
cons: Behind the times and too many politics.

job_title: Member Service Representative in Sacramento, CA
pros: Good benefits such as elaborate parties and great raffle gifts
cons: Not diversity friendly at all
